body:
As referenced @ https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/101611/bitcoin-core-0-21-0-loading-psbt-from-file-gets-error-unable-to-decode-psbt

I was able to reproduce the issue described, by saving & then immediately loading a PSBT file from my Bitcoin Core instance which has a watch-only wallet loaded.

I get the "global unsigned tx key is more than one byte" error using a file saved from the dialog that shows up after Send -> Create Unsigned

The PSBT on clipboard is OK and I can load it successfully via File -> Load PSBT from clipboard
The dialog that opens there offers the option to save to file. The file saved via that approach gives a different error when I try to load it: "extra data after PSBT"

This is on Windows so I suspect this is related to text vs. binary encoding messing with CRLF
In particular these ofstreams:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/cb2c578451770a29395f79f7077c362e1f54dfdd/src/qt/sendcoinsdialog.cpp#L437
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/c7ad94428ab6f54661d7a5441e1fdd0ebf034903/src/qt/psbtoperationsdialog.cpp#L148

should be created in binary mode (the default is text mode)
title: Invalid format when saving PSBT files
